page.title: 14GOWY VALLEY ECOLOGY,FLORA
page.content: Dominant{TREES-}Oak,Sycamore,Beech, Horse Chestnut,Hazel and Elder shrub under canopy.Hawthorn,Hazel &Buckthorn (Blackthorn)in hedgerows;these produce seeds or berries supporting fauna & birds. Old oaks support insect pests exploited by breeding birds. { {FLORA }of woodland floor-Bluebells, Violets,Primroses,Yellow Celandine, Foxglove,Anemone,White Wood Sorrel & Willow Herb.Other common flowers Chamomile,Angelica,Yarrow,Harebell, Cuckoo-pint,Meadow Cranesbill,Lady Bedstraw,Earthnut and Iris. {FAUNA}Woodland animals-grey squirrel, vole & mice.Foxes are common,few hares Frogs & newts are common.At Barrow mole,doormice & badgers are found. N.B.At Great Barrow{TREES}were planted by land owners so Plane,Beech,Sweet Chestnut,various Oak,Lime,Hornbeam,& Cedar are found in and around village.
